value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Avoiding circular dependency errors in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to avoid circular dependency errors in DAX! Article and download: https://sql.bi/59891/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #02: Add single column filter
value.excerpt: By default, a column filter in CALCULATE overwrites the existing filter over the same column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #03: Remove single column filters
value.excerpt: Use REMOVEFILTERS in CALCULATE to clear the filter from a column. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #10: Using TREATAS

value.title: Debugging DAX measures in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to debug a DAX measure that returns an incorrect result by using different techniques, with and without external tools. Article and download: https://sql.bi/782334?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: How to return 0 instead of BLANK in DAX
value.excerpt: How to force a measure to return zero instead of blank, in order to highlight combinations of attributes with no data.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/713576?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Optimizing fusion optimization for DAX measures

value.title: Using KEEPFILTERS in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains how to use KEEPFILTERS to intersect instead of overriding an existing filter context in DAX. Using FEEPFILTERS simplifies the code and improves performance. Article and download: https://sql.bi/751682?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175

value.title: Use DAX iterator functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn about what the family of iterator functions can do and how to use them in your DAX calculations. Calculations will include custom summarizations, ranking, and concatenation.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.

value.title: DAX Fridays! #3: SUM and SUMX
value.excerpt: Dax Fridays! Today we will go through: how to use SUM() and SUMX(), the difference between them and when should we use one vs the other.  The DAX SUM function calculates the sum of all numbers in a column while the DAX SUMX function returns the sum of an expression for each row in a table.  02:28 Create

value.title: DAX Fridays! #77: GROUPBY, CURRENTGROUP
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays, we will go through the DAX function GROUPBY with an example.  GROUPBY is similar as SUMMARIZE, but the difference is that in the expression part, you use DAX iterators to get your results. You can also nest GROUPBY functions to get for example the highest sales amount by country.
